analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis dge slong gnas brtan rnams chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa na /
translated: Venerable, when monks who are elders are engaged in a Dharma discussion that is a thorough analysis,🔽

original: glo bur du bka' mchid mchi la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: glo bur du bka' mchid mchi la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: Is there a case where a monk does not commit an infraction when he suddenly speaks in the midst of an elder monk’s Dharma discussion?

analyzed: yod de 'di lta ste dge slong gnas brtan dag chos ma yin par smra la /
translated: There is, when the elder monks speak non-Dharma and the younger monks speak Dharma.

analyzed: gsar bu dag ni chos smra bas glo bur du gtam zer na nyes byas su gyur pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If the elder monks speak non-Dharma and the younger monks speak Dharma, then if the younger monks suddenly speak, they do not commit an offense.🔽The same applies to speaking in the midst of a Dharma discussion.

original: gtam zer ba ni de nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i bar du glo bur du gtam zer ba ni de'i de nyid ni bsgo ba las 'gal bar byed pa nyid yin te /

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: And here, in the text of the request, it is said, “If a young man suddenly speaks to the elder Dharma teachers about non-Dharma, it is a downfall.”

original: de bas na dge 'dun nyid kyis bsgo ba gang yin pa de ni dge 'dun gyi bsgo ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dge 'dun nyid kyis bsgo ba gang yin pa de ni dge 'dun gyi bsgo ba yin te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir dge 'dun la ma gus pa dang sangs rgyas la ma gus pa ni shin tu sdig che ba yin te /

analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa ma gha dang / bha dha la yang ltung ba ma byung ba ste /

translated: If one generates disrespect for the training by saying, “What is the point of this little bit of training? What is the point of this small matter?” and so on, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: lhag ma lnga po rnams zhes bya ba 'di las bsdu ba bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma lnga po rnams zhes bya ba 'di las bsdu ba bya ste /

translated: If it is boiled, it is impaired from that, means that if that intoxicating drink is boiled, it is impaired from that intoxicating drink. The meaning is that there is no offense for drinking boiled alcohol.

translated: This is included by

translated: Here, “a single range” should be understood to mean “a single village.”

original: gang zhig nye 'khor zhes smos pa 'dis khyim gyi nye 'khor la shes par bya ba 'dis smras na byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig nye 'khor zhes smos pa 'dis khyim gyi nye 'khor la shes par bya ba 'dis smras na byed pa po nyid do //
translated: If one says, “I will go to the house,” the one who does the going commits the offense.

original: 'di la dge slong med na dge slong ma yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la smra bar bya ba'i phyir dge slong med na dge slong bzhin du dge slong ma'o //
analyzed: 'di la dge slong med na dge slong ma yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la smra bar bya ba'i phyir dge slong med na dge slong bzhin du dge slong ma'o //
translated: If there is no monk, it is the same for a nun. This means that if there is no monk to speak to about this training rule, a nun is like a monk.

original: gang zhig dge slong du ma gyur pa dang / dge slong mar yang ma gyur la de la ni smra bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig dge slong du ma gyur pa dang / dge slong mar yang ma gyur la de la ni smra bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should speak to one who is not a fully ordained monk or nun.

original: de yang med na dge tshul la'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma med na dge tshul la dge slong dang 'dra bar rig par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang med na dge tshul la'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma med na dge tshul la dge slong dang 'dra bar rig par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If that is not available, then to a novice monk. The meaning is that if a fully ordained monk is not available, then one should speak to a novice monk as if he were a fully ordained monk.

original: de yang med na dge slob ma'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang med na dge slob ma'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If that is not available, then to a female novice.

original: dge tshul de yang med na dge slob ma dge slong dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge tshul de yang med na dge slob ma dge slong dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: If that novice monk is not available, then to a female novice.

original: de yang med na dge tshul ma'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽dge @272a * //
analyzed: de yang med na dge tshul ma'o zhes bya ba ni / dge @272a * //
translated: If that is not available, then to a female novice.

original: slob ma de yang med na dge tshul ma yod na de la smra bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: slob ma de yang med na dge tshul ma yod na de la smra bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if that female novice is not available, then one should speak to a female novice.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis dge slong la smra bar bya zhing dge slong ma dang dge tshul dang / dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma la yang smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis dge slong la smra bar bya zhing dge slong ma dang dge tshul dang / dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma la yang smra bar bya ste /
translated: Here the text says: A fully ordained monk should speak to a fully ordained monk, and also to a fully ordained nun, a novice monk, a female novice, and a female novice.

original: 'khor lo bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should apply this to the other wheels.🔽If there is no understanding, it is nonexistence.

original: brda mi phrad pa ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni glen pa dang lkugs pa dang kla klo la sogs pa dag des brda mi phrad pa yin na smra bar bya ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: brda mi phrad pa ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni glen pa dang lkugs pa dang kla klo la sogs pa dag des brda mi phrad pa yin na smra bar bya ba med pa yin no //
translated: If there is no understanding with the deaf, the mute, barbarians, and so on, then there is no object of speech.

original: yod par gyur kyang brda mi phrad pa la ma smras par zhugs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: yod par gyur kyang brda mi phrad pa la ma smras par zhugs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: Even if there is existence, if there is no understanding, there is no offense in not speaking.🔽Here the treatise states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni tha mal par smras pa mi thos pa dang / tha mal pa smra mi shes pa gang dag yin pa de dang lhan cig 'dug pas ni de dag la ma smras par 'jug pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni tha mal par smras pa mi thos pa dang / tha mal pa smra mi shes pa gang dag yin pa de dang lhan cig 'dug pas ni de dag la ma smras par 'jug pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “There is no offense for one who is sitting with those who are deaf and mute and cannot understand ordinary speech, if he does not speak to them.”

original: mtshams gzhan na gnas pa dang gzhan gyi phyogs dang mthun pa dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang med pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan na gnas pa dang gzhan gyi phyogs dang mthun pa dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang med pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Also, “if one is in a different region or in a different country, there is no offense in not speaking.”

original: tha dad pa nyid phyogs gzhan la ltung ba gzhan gyi phyogs su gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid phyogs gzhan la ltung ba gzhan gyi phyogs su gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: The other party’s position is that they are different.

original: 'dir gzhung ni mtshams gzhan gyi sa la gnas pas nam mkha' la gnas pa la smras par 'jug pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no//
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni mtshams gzhan gyi sa la gnas pas nam mkha' la gnas pa la smras par 'jug pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no//
translated: Here, the text says, “There is no offense if one enters without speaking to the one who is in the sky, since he is in a different place.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni cig shos la yang sna tshogs pa dang / 'grogs pa rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dug pas de dag la ma smras par 'jug pa la ltung ba med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni cig shos la yang sna tshogs pa dang / 'grogs pa rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dug pas de dag la ma smras par 'jug pa la ltung ba med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “There is no offense if one enters without speaking to the others, since they are of different views and are staying there together.”

original: de bzhin du mi ma yin pa rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang lhan cig 'dug pas de la ma smras par 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi ma yin pa rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang lhan cig 'dug pas de la ma smras par 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: Similarly, “There is no offense if one enters without speaking to the one who is not human, since he is staying there as a renunciate and a fully ordained monk.”

original: sngon ltung ba byung ba dang dang po 'khrugs pa dang / rku thabs su gnas pa dang / dge slong ma sun phyung ba dang / mtha'i ltung ba byung ba dang / lhan cig 'dug pas de dag la ma smras par 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sngon ltung ba byung ba dang dang po 'khrugs pa dang / rku thabs su gnas pa dang / dge slong ma sun phyung ba dang / mtha'i ltung ba byung ba dang / lhan cig 'dug pas de dag la ma smras par 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has previously incurred a downfall, if he is disturbed, if he is staying by theft, if he has caused a nun to lose her respect, if he has incurred a downfall entailing expulsion, or if he does not inform them because he is staying with them.

original: de bas gzhan pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze dang lhan cig 'dug pas de rnams la ma dris bar 'jug pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas gzhan pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze dang lhan cig 'dug pas de rnams la ma dris bar 'jug pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: There is no offense if he enters without asking permission from any of them, but from other ascetics or brahmins who are staying with them.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbus su gnas pa'i dge slong dang dge slong ma dag ces bya ba 'dis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbus su gnas pa'i dge slong dang dge slong ma dag ces bya ba 'dis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as being included in the phrase “monks and nuns who are staying in the middle of the saṅgha of fully ordained monks.”

original: rdzu 'phrul @272b gyis ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul @272b gyis ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no offense if he uses his magical powers.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni grong du 'jug pa la bye brag gi don te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni grong du 'jug pa la bye brag gi don te /
translated: The word “if” has the meaning of a distinction.

original: 'dir 'di ni med par ni go ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni med par ni go ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not understood here that this is not the case.

original: gzhung gi sdeb sbyor bsgrub pa'i don 'di sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhung gi sdeb sbyor bsgrub pa'i don 'di sbyar ba yin no //
translated: This is the purpose of composing the metrical arrangement of the treatise.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rdzu 'phrul gyis nam mkha' la 'jug na ma smras kyang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rdzu 'phrul gyis nam mkha' la 'jug na ma smras kyang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the treatise states: “If one enters the sky by means of magical power, there is no offense even without speaking.”

original: dus ma yin par 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The second downfall is to go to a village at the wrong time.

original: // / gang la grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang la grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall for going to a village?

original: de'i phyir dus ma yin par khyim pa'i gzhi la sogs par 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus ma yin par khyim pa'i gzhi la sogs par 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “To go to a village at the wrong time without informing the householders.”

original: dge slong 'khod par ma smras par zhes bya ba 'dis dmigs kyis bsal bar gyur ba'i cho ga 'di yin no //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod par ma smras par zhes bya ba 'dis dmigs kyis bsal bar gyur ba'i cho ga 'di yin no //
translated: “Without informing the monks” indicates the exception to this rule.

original: dge slong 'khod pa la smras kyang khyim gzhi la sogs par dus ma yin par 'gro pa gang yin pa de la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la smras kyang khyim gzhi la sogs par dus ma yin par 'gro pa gang yin pa de la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if one informs the monks, if one goes to a village at the wrong time, that is the meaning of “to that.”

original: ci 'dir de 'ba' zhig la'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dir de 'ba' zhig la'am zhe na /
translated: Is it only that which is the downfall here?

original: de'i phyir de'i tshig gis dge 'dun spyan drangs pa na sbyin bdag kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis brim pa yol bar ma byas shig ces ma bsgo bar gsungs pa la sogs par rgyu ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshig gis dge 'dun spyan drangs pa na sbyin bdag kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis brim pa yol bar ma byas shig ces ma bsgo bar gsungs pa la sogs par rgyu ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, when the Saṅgha is invited by his words, the benefactor should not be told, “Do not delay the distribution because of me.”

original: de'i tshig gis dge 'dun spyan drangs pa na 'di skad ces kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba brim pa yol bar ma byas shig ces bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshig gis dge 'dun spyan drangs pa na 'di skad ces kho bo ma 'ongs pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba brim pa yol bar ma byas shig ces bsgo ba'o //
translated: When the Saṅgha is invited by his words, he should say, “Do not delay the distribution because of me.”

original: zas de sbyin pa po ni sbyin bdag ste ;
analyzed: zas de sbyin pa po ni sbyin bdag ste ;
translated: The donor is the benefactor.

original: des gnang ba ma byin par khyim gsum pa la sogs par 'gro ba smos pa gang yin pa de la yang kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des gnang ba ma byin par khyim gsum pa la sogs par 'gro ba smos pa gang yin pa de la yang kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement that going to a third house without the benefactor’s permission is a downfall is that this is a downfall.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul dang srog la sogs pa'i bar chad kyi dbang gis de dag la 'da' bar byed pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul dang srog la sogs pa'i bar chad kyi dbang gis de dag la 'da' bar byed pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood implicitly that there is no offense for transgressing this rule if it would create an obstacle to the life or training of a monk.

original: nyi ma de nyid dang gso sbyong byed pa'i dus de srid du chos 'di'i dbang du byas pa la tho 'tshams par byed na zhes bya ba gleng gzhi las phyi nas kha zas bgos pa la so sor nyid du gnang ba ste /
analyzed: nyi ma de nyid dang gso sbyong byed pa'i dus de srid du chos 'di'i dbang du byas pa la tho 'tshams par byed na zhes bya ba gleng gzhi las phyi nas kha zas bgos pa la so sor nyid du gnang ba ste /
translated: If one acts to harm someone in this very Dharma, for as long as the sun shines and for as long as the poṣadha is performed, then one is granted a separate poṣadha.

original: kha zas sna ma'i cho ga'i lhag ma nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kha zas sna ma'i cho ga'i lhag ma nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not a remainder of the procedure for the poṣadha meal.

original: 'dir tha dad pa rtsom pa ni mi mthun pa ste ;
analyzed: 'dir tha dad pa rtsom pa ni mi mthun pa ste ;
translated: Here, the beginning of a separate [poṣadha] is incompatible.

original: bden pa nyid kyi phyir phyis der 'gro ba na ltung byed du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa nyid kyi phyir phyis der 'gro ba na ltung byed du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because it is true, later, when one goes there, it remains a downfall.

original: de bas na bzhi pa la sogs pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na bzhi pa la sogs pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the fourth and so on, and the third and so on.

original: bzhi pa dang gsum pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang gsum pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The fourth and third are not [granted a separate poṣadha].

original: zan gcad par bya ba'i bsam pas gang zag re re la @273a * //
analyzed: zan gcad par bya ba'i bsam pas gang zag re re la @273a * //
translated: With the intention to fast, for each person

original: 'dir ltung byed gzhan yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ltung byed gzhan yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: here, another downfall should be understood.

original: grong du 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: grong du 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall of going to town.

original: // / shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: // / shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do //
translated: The primary role of discernment is to discern.

original: gang la 'du shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to what does discernment occur?

original: de'i phyir nam ma langs pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nam ma langs pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “before dawn has broken.”

original: nyin mo'i dang po ni skya rengs shar ba yin par gsungs la de'i mdun rol ni mtshan mo'i mtha' yin par rnam par gzhag na ci 'dir yang de bzhin du rnam par gzhag gam zhe na /
analyzed: nyin mo'i dang po ni skya rengs shar ba yin par gsungs la de'i mdun rol ni mtshan mo'i mtha' yin par rnam par gzhag na ci 'dir yang de bzhin du rnam par gzhag gam zhe na /
translated: The beginning of the day is said to be the rising of the dawn. The time before that is considered the end of the night. Is the same true here?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ni skya rengs tha ma ma shar ba nyid de yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ni skya rengs tha ma ma shar ba nyid de yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “before the last watch of the night has ended.”

original: dmar zhing skya ba ni tha ma'i skya rengs yin la de ma shar ba nyid ni 'dir nam ma langs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: dmar zhing skya ba ni tha ma'i skya rengs yin la de ma shar ba nyid ni 'dir nam ma langs pa nyid yin la /
translated: The last watch of the night is the reddish dawn. Before that has arisen, it is still before dawn.

original: shar ba nyid ni nam langs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shar ba nyid ni nam langs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When it has arisen, it is after dawn.

original: mi 'phrogs pa'i rin po che rnams sam rin po cher smos pa rnams la gang zhig 'dir chos tsam du brjod pa de ni 'od med pa nyid kyi gnas skabs su phal cher 'ga' zhig 'dir dmigs kyis bsal ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa'i rin po che rnams sam rin po cher smos pa rnams la gang zhig 'dir chos tsam du brjod pa de ni 'od med pa nyid kyi gnas skabs su phal cher 'ga' zhig 'dir dmigs kyis bsal ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: The jewels that are not to be taken away, or those that are called jewels, are the objects of the expression “mere dharma” in this verse. In the state of being without light, most of them are excluded here.

original: gang zhig 'di spong bar rigs pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i don du 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di spong bar rigs pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i don du 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse is taught in order to show that it is reasonable to abandon this.

original: mi 'phrogs pa nyid 'di la ltung ba bskyed pa'i yan lag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa nyid 'di la ltung ba bskyed pa'i yan lag nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is not a limb that produces a downfall in this case.

original: de bas na 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is included in this.

original: gnas skabs gang la de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas dang 'brel pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang la de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na / de'i phyir btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas dang 'brel pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In what state is one the agent of this?🔽Therefore, it is said: “In the state of being connected with the dwelling place of the harem.”

original: btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas dang 'brel pa nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btsun mo'i 'khor 'dug pa'i gnas dang 'brel pa nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: in the state of being connected with the dwelling place of the harem.

original: rang 'jug pa'i dbang nyid kyi phyir ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i dus su 'brel pa nyid la 'dir ma smros pa'i phyir ltung ba 'byin pa po zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rang 'jug pa'i dbang nyid kyi phyir ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i dus su 'brel pa nyid la 'dir ma smros pa'i phyir ltung ba 'byin pa po zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Because it is the very initiation of oneself, at the time of the downfall, the connection is with the one who commits the downfall.  Here, it is not mentioned, so it should be understood as “the one who commits the downfall.”

original: lus kyis zhes bya ba shugs kyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis zhes bya ba shugs kyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: “By body” is the connection by implication.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir dmigs par byed pa po nyid kyis sems tsam gyi 'brel par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir dmigs par byed pa po nyid kyis sems tsam gyi 'brel par 'gyur te /
translated: Because here, the one who objectifies is the very connection with mere mind.

original: de la yang re zhig sems la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid la ltung ba mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la yang re zhig sems la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid la ltung ba mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, in that case, it is not tenable that the mind is defiled by downfalls.

original: nyon mongs pa can nyid la yang bsdam par bya ba nyid rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can nyid la yang bsdam par bya ba nyid rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: And in the case of defilement, the one to be bound is established.

original: de lta bas na sems kyis ni ma yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems kyis ni ma yin no /
translated: Therefore, it is not by mind.

original: 'on kyang lus kyis kyang ltung ba 'byin pa po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang lus kyis kyang ltung ba 'byin pa po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the meaning is that the one who commits the downfall is by body.

original: mtshan mo dus gzhan gyi tshe na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba @273b 'di 'dir shes gtso bo nam ma langs pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba 'dis grub pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo dus gzhan gyi tshe na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba @273b 'di 'dir shes gtso bo nam ma langs pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba 'dis grub pa'o //
translated: This is established by the statement, “at dawn, not at another time at night.”

original: ci nub mo gang la brel pa nyid du 'gro ba'i skabs byed pa nyid la yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci nub mo gang la brel pa nyid du 'gro ba'i skabs byed pa nyid la yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it only when there is an opportunity to go out at night that one is in haste?

original: de'i phyir de tshe skabs ma yin pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de tshe skabs ma yin pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, “at that time, even when there is no opportunity.”

original: de'i nub mo de dang 'brel pa nyid kyi skabs ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i nub mo de dang 'brel pa nyid kyi skabs ma yin pa ste /
translated: That night is related to the opportunity, but it is not an opportunity.

original: 'brel pa nyid 'di la zhes bya ba de'i tshe skabs ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid 'di la zhes bya ba de'i tshe skabs ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the opportunity at that time when there is no opportunity.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gang gis tshe 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus 'jug par byed pa'i gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su ma gnang mod kyi gnas de ni yod do //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gang gis tshe 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus 'jug par byed pa'i gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su ma gnang mod kyi gnas de ni yod do //
translated: Here is the text: “When Ārya Śāriputra was about to enter parinirvāṇa, the Blessed One said, ‘Śāriputra, you should not enter parinirvāṇa without my permission. However, that state exists.’🔽Even though the Blessed One did not permit it, he did so.

original: gang zhig yid ches pa 'di nyid kyi dbang du byas na rjes su yang sun 'byin pa nyid du grags pa de bas na mdo 'di byas /
analyzed: gang zhig yid ches pa 'di nyid kyi dbang du byas na rjes su yang sun 'byin pa nyid du grags pa de bas na mdo 'di byas /
translated: This is the very trust that is referred to. Since it is well known that even the Buddha refuted this, this sūtra was composed.

original: mtshan mo du mar 'brel pa nyid la thams cad la 'du shes gcig kho na byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan mo du mar 'brel pa nyid la thams cad la 'du shes gcig kho na byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is the one who does this the same person who has the single perception throughout the night?

original: de'i phyir mtshan mo re re la'o zhes bya ba smos te /🔽nyin mtshan gyi dang po ma yin pa la tha ma ma yin pa med pa nyid do zhes smos pa des ni nyin mtshan gyi cho ga 'di bstan pa yin gyi mtshan mo 'ba' zhig gi mtshan nyid bstan pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di las 'jug
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan mo re re la'o zhes bya ba smos te / nyin mtshan gyi dang po ma yin pa la tha ma ma yin pa med pa nyid do zhes smos pa des ni nyin mtshan gyi cho ga 'di bstan pa yin gyi mtshan mo 'ba' zhig gi mtshan nyid bstan pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di las 'jug
translated: Therefore, it is said, “each night.”

original: pa shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: pa shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is said that the first part of the night is not the last part of the night, this rule is taught for the day and night, but it is not taught as a characteristic of the night alone. Therefore, it is not to be understood as applying to this rule.

original: mtshan mo'i cha gang yang rung ba nyid la ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i cha gang yang rung ba nyid la ni ltung byed do //
translated: But if it is any part of the night, it is a downfall.

original: 'od dmar po chags pa gang yin pa de 'das par gyur pa ni mtshan mo'i dang po yin te /
analyzed: 'od dmar po chags pa gang yin pa de 'das par gyur pa ni mtshan mo'i dang po yin te /
translated: The first part of the night is when the red glow of dawn has not yet appeared.

original: gal te nam 'das pa nyid bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nam 'das pa nyid bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If it is taught that the night has passed, it is to be understood according to the explanation that follows.

original: rtsom pa gcig par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan gcig la bar ma chad pa'i gnas skabs la ltung ba gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtsom pa gcig par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan gcig la bar ma chad pa'i gnas skabs la ltung ba gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Because the composition is the same, there is one offense in the state of uninterrupted contact with one characteristic.

original: bar du chad pa la ni ltung byed gzhan yin te /
analyzed: bar du chad pa la ni ltung byed gzhan yin te /
translated: If there is an interruption, there is another offense,

original: rtsom pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsom pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the composition is different.

original: gang nas brtsams te sgor zhugs pa dang btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du gnas pa rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang nas brtsams te sgor zhugs pa dang btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du gnas pa rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: From where does one begin to understand entering the door and staying in the harem?

original: de'i phyir de'i sgro'i gtan pa'i nyen kor gnyis ni de'i dang po yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sgro'i gtan pa'i nyen kor gnyis ni de'i dang po yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “The two sides of the door bolt of that are its beginning.”

original: btsun mo'i 'khor gyi gnas de'i sgo gtan pa gang yin pa de'i nyen kor gyi mdun du ltung ba dang phyis ltung ba dag la srid par gyur pa'i phyogs des ji srid du de'i nang gi ngos kyi btsun mo'i 'khor gyi gnas de'i dang po yin par rig
analyzed: btsun mo'i 'khor gyi gnas de'i sgo gtan pa gang yin pa de'i nyen kor gyi mdun du ltung ba dang phyis ltung ba dag la srid par gyur pa'i phyogs des ji srid du de'i nang gi ngos kyi btsun mo'i 'khor gyi gnas de'i dang po yin par rig
translated: The door bolt of that harem is the beginning of that harem inside, up to the side where there is a possibility of falling and later falling.

original: par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it should be understood up to that.

original: gal te sgo ma bcad na ni nye 'khor gyi mtha' 'dir dang po rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sgo ma bcad na ni nye 'khor gyi mtha' 'dir dang po rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: If the door is not closed, the first part is the area outside the door.

original: sgo bcad na ni de'i tshe sgo gtan gyi @274a * //
analyzed: sgo bcad na ni de'i tshe sgo gtan gyi @274a * //
translated: If the door is closed, the first part is the area of the doorsill.🔽The same applies to the king’s palace and the city.

original: mtha'o // rgyal po'i pho brang dang grong khyer dag kher dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar btsun mo'i 'khor du 'dug pa'i gnas kyi dang po'i sgo gtan pa'i nyen kor gyi mtha' gnyis ni dang po yin no //
analyzed: mtha'o // rgyal po'i pho brang dang grong khyer dag kher dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar btsun mo'i 'khor du 'dug pa'i gnas kyi dang po'i sgo gtan pa'i nyen kor gyi mtha' gnyis ni dang po yin no //
translated: Just as the first part of the area where the harem is located is the area outside the doorsill,

original: de bzhin du rgyal po'i pho brang dang grong khyer dag gi dang po yang sgo'i gtan pa'i nye kor gyi mtha' gnyis yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal po'i pho brang dang grong khyer dag gi dang po yang sgo'i gtan pa'i nye kor gyi mtha' gnyis yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: so the first part of the king’s palace and the city is the area outside the doorsill.🔽In the case of a city surrounded by a moat, the first part is the line in the middle of the door.

original: 'obs kyis bskor ba nyid la ni sgo'i dbus kyi ri mo la ni sgo'i dogs kyi dbus nyid du nges pa 'di ni cho ga dang por khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'obs kyis bskor ba nyid la ni sgo'i dbus kyi ri mo la ni sgo'i dogs kyi dbus nyid du nges pa 'di ni cho ga dang por khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This is the rule to be understood.

original: zhar la byung ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: zhar la byung ba bshad zin to /
translated: The digression is finished.

original: // / gang du 'di byed pa po nyid ces bya ba 'di la 'jug pa gzhan ltung byed gzhan byed pa'i tshul gzhan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / gang du 'di byed pa po nyid ces bya ba 'di la 'jug pa gzhan ltung byed gzhan byed pa'i tshul gzhan brjod par bya ste /
translated: “Where” is to be supplied to this verse.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang gi gnas la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang gi gnas la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Also in the royal palace” means

original: 'brel pa nyid la'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid la'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: that it is connected with the palace.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong nam langs pa las nam ma langs par 'du shes bzhin du rgyal po'i pho brang gi sgo'i gtan pa las 'das par byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong nam langs pa las nam ma langs par 'du shes bzhin du rgyal po'i pho brang gi sgo'i gtan pa las 'das par byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says, “If a monk, thinking it is not dawn when it is dawn, passes beyond the boundary of the royal palace, he commits an offense entailing suspension.”

original: grong khyer ngang gi nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni grong khyer gyi gnas dang 'brel pa nyid las ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: grong khyer ngang gi nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni grong khyer gyi gnas dang 'brel pa nyid las ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “In the city, a minor offense” means that a minor offense is incurred by the act of going beyond the boundary of the city.

original: snga ma'i ltung byed ces bya ba'i 'di la nyes byas kyi tshig dang skabs kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i ltung byed ces bya ba'i 'di la nyes byas kyi tshig dang skabs kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: “The previous offense” is understood from the context to be a minor offense.

original: ci gang yang rung ba la 'di dang 'brel pa nyid la nyes byas ni yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci gang yang rung ba la 'di dang 'brel pa nyid la nyes byas ni yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is there any offense if one is related to any of these?

original: de'i phyir gal te de'i don nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te de'i don nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If it is for that purpose.”

original: gang zhig 'di 'brel pa gnyis brtsams na gal te gcig la yang 'di'i don du 'brel pa nyid ni 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di 'brel pa gnyis brtsams na gal te gcig la yang 'di'i don du 'brel pa nyid ni 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one begins a second related action, if it is for the purpose of the first, then there is no offense.

original: 'di la cig shos kyi kha na ma tho ba de yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la cig shos kyi kha na ma tho ba de yang ngo //
translated: The offense of the other is also in this.

original: 'di la kha na ma tho ba gnyis de yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la kha na ma tho ba gnyis de yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The two offenses are also in this.

original: gang du dus ma yin par 'dug pa'i kha na ma tho ba med pa skya rengs dang po shar ba'i mdun rol du ma smras par 'jug pa 'di la de'i dgongs pa can gyi tshig ste de yang 'dir ltung byed du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du dus ma yin par 'dug pa'i kha na ma tho ba med pa skya rengs dang po shar ba'i mdun rol du ma smras par 'jug pa 'di la de'i dgongs pa can gyi tshig ste de yang 'dir ltung byed du rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the statement of the one who intends that in a place where there is no offense of staying at the wrong time, if one enters without speaking before the first dawn has risen, that is also a downfall.

original: de'i phyir de la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is taught in that.

original: ci gang yang rung ba'i 'brel pa snga ma dag la grong khyer dang 'brel pa dang de'i don nyid du kha na ma tho ba de yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci gang yang rung ba'i 'brel pa snga ma dag la grong khyer dang 'brel pa dang de'i don nyid du kha na ma tho ba de yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: If one has any connection with the previous ones, is there a downfall for having a connection with a city and its purpose?

original: de'i phyir gal te rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang bar chad dang / gdul ba'i dbang gis ma yin pa @274b la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang bar chad dang / gdul ba'i dbang gis ma yin pa @274b la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “unless it is for the sake of the king, queen, prince, or ministers, or to avert a calamity, or to subdue someone.”

original: 'dir gdul ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba'i lung ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i pu'i byung ba'i mtha' las rjes su gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gdul ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba'i lung ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i pu'i byung ba'i mtha' las rjes su gnang ba yin te /
translated: Here, the scriptural source for going for the sake of subduing someone is the story of Śāriputra in the Avadāna.

original: bye brag tu ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bye brag tu ni ltung ba med do //
translated: In particular, there is no downfall.

original: 'dir lung ni rgyal pos bos pa dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang bar chad brgyad po dag las gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur na nyes pa med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir lung ni rgyal pos bos pa dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang bar chad brgyad po dag las gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur na nyes pa med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, the scriptural source is the statement that there is no fault if any of the following are present: the king summons you, the queen, the prince, or the ministers, or one of the eight concerns is at hand.

original: ma bzlugs par rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma bzlugs par rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not enter the king’s palace without being summoned.

original: 'o na 'dir gzhung ni ma zhus par rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug par mi bya bar dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi gzhi las gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na 'dir gzhung ni ma zhus par rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug par mi bya bar dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi gzhi las gsungs so //
translated: But here, the text does not say that one should not enter the king’s palace, but that one should not enter the king’s palace without being invited.

original: khyod kyis kyang gya tshom du rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug par mi bya bar sgor bsdad nas sh'a kya'i dge slong 'ongs so zhes brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang gya tshom du rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug par mi bya bar sgor bsdad nas sh'a kya'i dge slong 'ongs so zhes brjod par bya zhing /
translated: And you should not enter the king’s palace without being invited. You should wait outside the gate and say, ‘A Śākya bhikṣu has come.’🔽If he says, ‘Come in,’ then you should enter.”

original: gal te spyon cig zer na 'jug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽rgyal po'i pho brang du nub mo 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: gal te spyon cig zer na 'jug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // rgyal po'i pho brang du nub mo 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall.

original: // / gang la bslab pa bstan pa la log par bsgrub pa ni rnam pa gsum gnang ste /
analyzed: // / gang la bslab pa bstan pa la log par bsgrub pa ni rnam pa gsum gnang ste /
translated: There are three ways of misbehaving with regard to the training that has been taught:

original: khyad du gsod pa dang spong pa dang bslab pa'i gzhi dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'o //
analyzed: khyad du gsod pa dang spong pa dang bslab pa'i gzhi dngos po la khyad du gsod pa'o //
translated: disrespect, rejection, and disrespecting the actual basis of the training.

original: de gnyis gang yang sngags kyi gzhi thob pa las brtags pa te /
analyzed: de gnyis gang yang sngags kyi gzhi thob pa las brtags pa te /
translated: These two are considered to be the basis of the mantra.

original: de ni mdun nas rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni mdun nas rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: This is presented in the following.

original: de bas na don de nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na don de nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is presented in this way.

original: dngos po la khyad du gsod pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dngos po la khyad du gsod pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: This is the contempt for things.

original: 'dir yang dag par zhugs te /
analyzed: 'dir yang dag par zhugs te /
translated: Here, it is the correct engagement.

original: de bas na 'di nyid du rnam par 'byed par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid du rnam par 'byed par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is analyzed here.

original: gang la 'di'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang la 'di'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall here?

original: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa 'don pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa 'don pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when reciting the Pratimokṣa Sūtra,

original: de la lan gnyis nyams su myong zhing yid rmongs pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de la lan gnyis nyams su myong zhing yid rmongs pa ma yin pas /
translated: there is no confusion in experiencing it twice.

original: 'di la chos 'di yod par gzod shes so zhes zer ba de la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la chos 'di yod par gzod shes so zhes zer ba de la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, it is said that this exists in the Dharma, and it is said that it is known now.

original: lan gnyis nyams su myong zhing zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa 'dod pa gang gis lan gnyis nyams su myong ba de yis so //
analyzed: lan gnyis nyams su myong zhing zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa 'dod pa gang gis lan gnyis nyams su myong ba de yis so //
translated: Experiencing it twice means that it is experienced twice by one who desires to recite the Pratimokṣa Sūtra.

original: nyams su myong ba med pa nyid la gnyis po 'dis ma grol ba la nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba med pa nyid la gnyis po 'dis ma grol ba la nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: In the absence of experience, it should be understood that the offense is a minor offense for not being liberated by these two.

original: gal te dge slong dag gis deng shes par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong dag gis deng shes par 'gyur na /
translated: If the bhikṣus were to understand it now,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di ni sngar gnas pa lan gnyis lan gsum du gso sbyong gi las slar brjod pa gang yin pa de'i sa 'di ni bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di ni sngar gnas pa lan gnyis lan gsum du gso sbyong gi las slar brjod pa gang yin pa de'i sa 'di ni bsdu ba yin no //
translated: This is the summary of the matter of the venerable one who, when the purification ceremony is being performed, twice or thrice repeats the recitation of the ceremony.

original: yid @275a * //🔽rmongs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo la rgan po kho na la mi shes par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: yid @275a * // rmongs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo la rgan po kho na la mi shes par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Not confused.🔽This means that, in the matter of what is not a downfall, the elder is not confused.

original: yid rmongs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: yid rmongs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The phrase “not confused” is used because it is not the case that he is confused.

original: rigs pa las spyod pa 'di dge ba yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa las spyod pa 'di dge ba yin te /
translated: This practice is virtuous because it is reasonable.

original: don gang la yid rmongs pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: don gang la yid rmongs pa ma yin pas so //
translated: It is not the case that he is confused about the meaning.

original: de bas na ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, this formulation of a downfall is unreasonable.

original: kha na ma tho ba 'di la thams cad ma gus par gyur pa'i sems der gal te sangs rgyas la yang 'dir 'di ma grub pas ma gus pa'i ltung byed kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba 'di la thams cad ma gus par gyur pa'i sems der gal te sangs rgyas la yang 'dir 'di ma grub pas ma gus pa'i ltung byed kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: If the thought of disrespect toward all of this is the offense, then even in regard to the Buddha, this is not established here. Therefore, one should understand that it is a downfall due to disrespect.

original: gal te ma yin na ma gus pa'i nyes byas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te ma yin na ma gus pa'i nyes byas kyang ma yin no //
translated: If it is not so, then it is not even a minor offense due to disrespect.

original: brdzun du smra ba yin na ni brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed gzhan du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba yin na ni brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed gzhan du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a lie, then it is also a downfall of lying.

original: mtshan gzhan gyis 'don pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mtshan gzhan gyis 'don pa'i tshe /
translated: When reciting the Prātimokṣa with another name,

original: thun mong ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thun mong ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mtshan gzhan 'don pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan gzhan 'don pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When reciting the Prātimokṣa with another name,🔽it is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽When reciting the Prātimokṣa, the nuns say, “Bhikṣus, it is like this.

original: dge slong la ltung byed do zhes bya ba dge slong ma rnams kyis gso sbyong 'don pa'i tshe bslab pa mthun mong pa'i phyir da ltar bdag gis shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong la ltung byed do zhes bya ba dge slong ma rnams kyis gso sbyong 'don pa'i tshe bslab pa mthun mong pa'i phyir da ltar bdag gis shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: I have just now understood that this Dharma is included in the sūtras.”🔽In the presentation of non-downfalls, the text says:🔽“Venerables, when the nuns recite the Sūtra of Individual Liberation, they say, ‘It is like this.

original: ltung ba ma yin pa bstan pa las 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las btsun pa dge slong ma rnams kyis so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa na 'di skad ces 'di ltar chos 'di yang mdo'i nang du 'dus par bdag gis da gzod shes so zhes
analyzed: ltung ba ma yin pa bstan pa las 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las btsun pa dge slong ma rnams kyis so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa na 'di skad ces 'di ltar chos 'di yang mdo'i nang du 'dus par bdag gis da gzod shes so zhes
translated: I have just now understood that this Dharma is included in the sūtras.’

original: mchi na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: mchi na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: What is the offense?”

original: gal te bslab pa thun mong ma yin pa la bsams te smras na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te bslab pa thun mong ma yin pa la bsams te smras na ltung ba med do //
translated: If one speaks with the thought of the uncommon training, there is no offense.

original: gang gi tshe bslab pa thun mong pa las bsams te smras na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bslab pa thun mong pa las bsams te smras na nyes byas so //
translated: If one speaks with the thought of the common training, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The same should be applied to fully ordained nuns.

original: mdo sde dang ldan pa smras na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdo sde dang ldan pa smras na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one says, “It is in the sūtras,”

original: mdo sde dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi smra ba na de skad zer ba de la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mdo sde dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi smra ba na de skad zer ba de la nyes byas so //
translated: if one speaks of a topic of training that is in the sūtras, there is an offense of wrong conduct for saying that.

original: gzhung kha cig las 'dir gzhung ni 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i mdo ma gtogs pa la 'di skad ces 'di ltar chos 'di yang mdo'i nang du gtogs mdo'i nang du 'dus pa dang / zla ba phyed phyed cing bton bar bdag gis da gzod shes so zhes zer na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las 'dir gzhung ni 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i mdo ma gtogs pa la 'di skad ces 'di ltar chos 'di yang mdo'i nang du gtogs mdo'i nang du 'dus pa dang / zla ba phyed phyed cing bton bar bdag gis da gzod shes so zhes zer na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In some texts, the text says, “Except for the sūtras that are in the Vinaya, if one says, ‘This Dharma is in the sūtras, it is included in the sūtras, and I have just now learned it during the fortnightly recitation,’ there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: thun mong ma yin pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense for the uncommon training.

original: mtshan gzhan bstan pa 'di ni bslab pa'i gzhi thun mong ma yin pa 'don pa'i tshe ltung ba med @275b pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan gzhan bstan pa 'di ni bslab pa'i gzhi thun mong ma yin pa 'don pa'i tshe ltung ba med @275b pa'o //
translated: This is the other name for the occasion when there is no offense for reciting the uncommon bases of training.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe ma gus par nyan pa nye bar bsgrub pa 'gyod du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe ma gus par nyan pa nye bar bsgrub pa 'gyod du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When reciting the Pratimoksha Sutra, one should make the listener regretfully establish non-disrespect.

original: bdag gis da gzod shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa tsam la yang snar 'dug pa na 'dod pa la ma gus par nyan pa la nye bar sbyar ba'i rig pa bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis da gzod shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa tsam la yang snar 'dug pa na 'dod pa la ma gus par nyan pa la nye bar sbyar ba'i rig pa bya'o //
translated: Even if one says I just now understood and so forth, if one sits in the nose, one should understand that it is applied to listening to desire with non-respect.

original: dngos su ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos su ni ma yin te /
translated: In reality, it is not so.

original: gang zhig 'di bstan pa ci kho bo cag las 'di nyid gcig pu yin nam /🔽kho bo cag gis kyang 'dod pa'i rnam pa rtog pa la yang rnam par rtog dgos so //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di bstan pa ci kho bo cag las 'di nyid gcig pu yin nam / kho bo cag gis kyang 'dod pa'i rnam pa rtog pa la yang rnam par rtog dgos so //
translated: If one asks What is this teaching? one should think Is this only for me?🔽Even I must think in the form of desire.

original: gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la yang rnam par rtog dgos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la yang rnam par rtog dgos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
translated: One should also think in the form of malice and in the form of harmfulness, and so forth.

original: de yang ma gus par nyan pa la nye bar sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ma gus par nyan pa la nye bar sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is applied to listening with disrespect.

original: 'gyod du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni 'di ni lam dam pa'o zhes bya ba'i bslab pa la nyes bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyod du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni 'di ni lam dam pa'o zhes bya ba'i bslab pa la nyes bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should cause regret means that one should cause regret for the training that says, This is the holy path.

original: 'dir mang po'i tshig ni du ma nye bar gnas pa brjod pa la nyan pa po rnams thams cad kyis 'dir 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'dir mang po'i tshig ni du ma nye bar gnas pa brjod pa la nyan pa po rnams thams cad kyis 'dir 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: Here, the many words are stated for the sake of expressing the many that are present, and all listeners should engage in this. This is the meaning of the teaching.

original: 'dir 'gyod du gzhug pa ni tshe dang ldan pa khyod ma rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'gyod du gzhug pa ni tshe dang ldan pa khyod ma rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, causing regret is stated as, Venerable one, you have not attained... and so on.

original: nyes byas dang ma gus par gso sbyong la sogs pa thos pa zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di las rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes byas dang ma gus par gso sbyong la sogs pa thos pa zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di las rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this ritual of listening to the purification of faults and disrespect and so on is to be understood from this text.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsong pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi'i dngos po la khyad du gsong pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: It is a downfall due to a lapse in discipline to be contemptuous of the substance of the points of training.

original: // / gang la khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang la khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall of making a needle case?

original: de'i phyir ba so dang rus pa dang rva'i khab ral byed dam byed du bcug pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ba so dang rus pa dang rva'i khab ral byed dam byed du bcug pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “if he makes a needle case or has it made out of ivory, bone, or horn.”

original: ba so 'am rus pa'am rva'i khab ral byed dam byed du bcug pa la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba so 'am rus pa'am rva'i khab ral byed dam byed du bcug pa la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the offense occurs if he makes a needle case or has it made out of ivory, bone, or horn.

original: 'di man chad shing bal gyis gos par byas pa ma gtogs pa'i ltung byed rnams la byed du 'jug pa 'ba' zhig gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di man chad shing bal gyis gos par byas pa ma gtogs pa'i ltung byed rnams la byed du 'jug pa 'ba' zhig gsungs mod kyi /
translated: From here on, the offenses are stated only in terms of having others do the work, except for the offense of using cotton.

original: rang byed pa la ches lci bas zhes bya ba de yang 'di rnams kyi khongs su bsdus so //
analyzed: rang byed pa la ches lci bas zhes bya ba de yang 'di rnams kyi khongs su bsdus so //
translated: However, since it is very serious if one does it oneself, that is included in these.

original: shin tu yang ba brjod pa na lci ba ma brjod kyang grub pa nyid ces bya ba 'di de tsam zhig smos so //
analyzed: shin tu yang ba brjod pa na lci ba ma brjod kyang grub pa nyid ces bya ba 'di de tsam zhig smos so //
translated: Even though it is not stated, it is established by the mere statement, “If he makes a very light one, even though he does not say it is heavy.”

original: khab ral dang khri'i rkang pa 'chos pa las kyang dge slong gis bcag pa na'o //
analyzed: khab ral dang khri'i rkang pa 'chos pa las kyang dge slong gis bcag pa na'o //
translated: If a monk breaks a needle case or a bed leg,

original: ba so la sogs pa yang rin che ba'i phyir bkag pa'o //
analyzed: ba so la sogs pa yang rin che ba'i phyir bkag pa'o //
translated: ivory, etc., are prohibited because they are valuable.

original: de lta bas na gang la ches rin che ba'i phyir de yang 'dir bkag par rig @276a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang la ches rin che ba'i phyir de yang 'dir bkag par rig @276a * //
translated: Therefore, since it is the most precious, it is understood that it is refuted here.

original: par bya ste /
analyzed: par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that even that is prohibited here, because it is very valuable.

original: tha na mtshon cha la sogs pa yang ngo //🔽de la yang de 'di bas pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha na mtshon cha la sogs pa yang ngo // de la yang de 'di bas pa nyid do //
translated: Even a weapon, etc.🔽is not suitable for him, even if it is made of precious materials.

original: rin po che las byas pa ni rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir nyes byas byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rin po che las byas pa ni rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir nyes byas byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is a wrong action because it is unsuitable.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: In this regard, the text of the Questions of Revata Sutra states:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis rin po che las bgyis pa'i khab ral bgyid du stsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis rin po che las bgyis pa'i khab ral bgyid du stsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “Venerable One, if a monk asks someone to make a needle case made of precious materials, what is his offense?”

original: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽byas zin pa rnyed pa dang byas zin pa spyod pa dag ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /🔽ras la sogs pa rnyed pa de las byas pa dang byed du bcug pa la ltung ba med pa dang na smad pa yang med de /
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no // byas zin pa rnyed pa dang byas zin pa spyod pa dag ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni / ras la sogs pa rnyed pa de las byas pa dang byed du bcug pa la ltung ba med pa dang na smad pa yang med de /
translated: “It is a wrong action.”🔽There is no offense if one obtains one that has already been made, or if one uses one that has already been made.

original: byas pa 'di nyid las bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa 'di nyid las bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if one obtains cloth, etc., and has it made, or if one uses it, because this is permitted.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: In this regard, the text of the Questions of Revata Sutra states:

original: byas pa rnyed pa dang byas pa la spyod pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa rnyed pa dang byas pa la spyod pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There is no offense if the needle case is lost or if the needle case is being repaired.

original: bcag pa nyid ma dris par 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bcag pa nyid ma dris par 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
translated: One should not accept a confession of a downfall from someone who has not broken his or her needle case.

original: gang gi mdun du ltung ba 'chags pa des khab ral de khyod kyis bcag gam zhes dri bar bya ste /🔽de skad ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi mdun du ltung ba 'chags pa des khab ral de khyod kyis bcag gam zhes dri bar bya ste / de skad ma dris par ltung ba 'chags pa blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: The person who is to receive the confession of a downfall should ask, “Have you broken your needle case?”🔽If the other person has not broken his or her needle case, the confession should not be accepted.

original: gal te ma bcags na ma bshags pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ma bcags par ltung ba 'chags par byed na de'i ltung ba de ma bshags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te ma bcags na ma bshags pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ma bcags par ltung ba 'chags par byed na de'i ltung ba de ma bshags pa nyid yin no //
translated: If the needle case has not been broken, the downfall has not been confessed.🔽The same applies to the five following rules.

original: 'og ma lnga po dag la yang de ngag dang bcas pa dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi 'di'i 'og ma bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad las gyur pa'i gong ma rnams de ma thag par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og ma lnga po dag la yang de ngag dang bcas pa dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi 'di'i 'og ma bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad las gyur pa'i gong ma rnams de ma thag par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The five following rules are the rules concerning the size of the Sugata’s robe, etc. These rules should be understood in the same way as the rule concerning the needle case.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni ma dris par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni ma dris par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase those refers to the passage that states, without having been asked...

original: bcad pa dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs par bya ste /🔽bcad pa nyid ma dris par 'chags par blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcad pa dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs par bya ste / bcad pa nyid ma dris par 'chags par blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: You should understand that this refers to the act of confessing.🔽You should not confess without having been asked.

original: gal te ma bcad pa na chags pa blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te ma bcad pa na chags pa blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If you are not asked, you should not confess.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Here, the text of the Vinaya Verses states:

original: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyed kyis dngos po de bcad dam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi mdun du 'chags par byed pa des khyed kyis dngos po de bcad dam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: The person in front of whom you are confessing should ask, 'Have you stopped that action?'

original: ma dris par bshags na ltung ba de dag bshags pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ma dris par bshags na ltung ba de dag bshags pa ma yin la /
translated: If you confess without having been asked, then that offense has not been confessed,

original: dge slong de la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong de la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and the monk who confesses it commits an offense.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad las gyur pa'i ltung byed la bcad nas ltung byed du ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad las gyur pa'i ltung byed la bcad nas ltung byed du ni ma gsungs so //
translated: The offense that is a result of exceeding the right size of the Tathāgata’s robe is not called an offense that is a result of cutting.

original: 'dir rnam par 'byed pa las bcad nas @276b zhes bya ba 'di la don bstan par gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par 'byed pa las bcad nas @276b zhes bya ba 'di la don bstan par gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the Vinaya Verses states, cutting, but this does not indicate the meaning of the term.

original: de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad las gyur pa las gzhan dag la bcad pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad las gyur pa las gzhan dag la bcad pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is cut and sewn from cloth that is the measure of the Sugata's robe.🔽What is the meaning of cut and sewn?

original: ci bcags pa dang bcad pa nyid ces bya ba 'di la rang bzhin gyi don 'di nyid kyis de ltar nyid du gnas spyir btang bar byas nas /
analyzed: ci bcags pa dang bcad pa nyid ces bya ba 'di la rang bzhin gyi don 'di nyid kyis de ltar nyid du gnas spyir btang bar byas nas /
translated: Having stated the general rule with just this meaning,

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the exceptions,

original: de'i phyir bcad pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcad pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, Therefore, it is cut and sewn.

original: ci lnga po dag la yang bcad pa dang ldan pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci lnga po dag la yang bcad pa dang ldan pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are the five also cut and sewn?

original: de'i phyir gnyis pa la ni bsdus pa dang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis pa la ni bsdus pa dang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, The second is gathered.

original: shing bal gyis gos par byas pa zhes bya ba bslab pa'i gzhi la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shing bal gyis gos par byas pa zhes bya ba bslab pa'i gzhi la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Covered with cotton wool means in the training precept.

original: khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: khab ral 'chos pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfalls are:

original: // / rkang pa dma' ba dang ldan pa'i khri la nyal bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / rkang pa dma' ba dang ldan pa'i khri la nyal bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not sleep on a bed with low legs.

original: gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mgo bo la nyes par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sa dang gang la 'khyil ba ma bcags par sbrul gyis sos btab pa bsgrub pa mi 'byung ba de lta bu'i sa la zhes bya ba gleng gzhi las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mgo bo la nyes par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sa dang gang la 'khyil ba ma bcags par sbrul gyis sos btab pa bsgrub pa mi 'byung ba de lta bu'i sa la zhes bya ba gleng gzhi las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The place where the head of the snake is turned toward the direction of the person who is to be bitten, and the place where the snake is coiled and has not moved its head, are the places where the rite of biting will not be effective.

original: mal dang 'brel pa'i khri'i nye 'khor gyi phyogs su rkang pa bkru bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyal ba'i gnas dang 'brel pa'i khri'i nyen kor dang 'brel pa'i phyogs su rkang pa bkru bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mal dang 'brel pa'i khri'i nye 'khor gyi phyogs su rkang pa bkru bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyal ba'i gnas dang 'brel pa'i khri'i nyen kor dang 'brel pa'i phyogs su rkang pa bkru bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not wash one's feet in the vicinity of a bed that is connected to a sleeping place.

original: khyim pa'i gnas mal gyi gnas gzhan dang 'brel pa nyed la 'di dang mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: khyim pa'i gnas mal gyi gnas gzhan dang 'brel pa nyed la 'di dang mi mthun pa ste /
translated: This is different from the other places connected to the sleeping places of householders.

original: de bas na de las yang nyes pa 'di'o //
analyzed: de bas na de las yang nyes pa 'di'o //
translated: Therefore, this is another fault.

original: khyim pa'i gnas mal nyid la 'di ni shin tu na smad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i gnas mal nyid la 'di ni shin tu na smad par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as a very serious offense in the case of householders' sleeping places.

original: ci thams cad kyis bkru bar mi bya 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci thams cad kyis bkru bar mi bya 'am zhe na /
translated: Should one not wash one's feet at all?

original: de'i phyir lham yod pas so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lham yod pas so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “because of the existence of the sandals.🔽”

original: ci 'dir phyogs thams cad du gzhan la bkru bar bya ba nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dir phyogs thams cad du gzhan la bkru bar bya ba nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it the case that all sides of the sandals are to be washed?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis ni mgo logs dang rkang logs ma gtogs par ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis ni mgo logs dang rkang logs ma gtogs par ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “the other sides are not to be washed, except for the head side and the foot side.🔽”

original: bkru bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bkru bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Are not to be washed” is to be supplied.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'dis kyis bka' stsal pa gang dag la mchil lham mi bdog pa de dag gis mgo logs sam rkang logs su bkru bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'dis kyis bka' stsal pa gang dag la mchil lham mi bdog pa de dag gis mgo logs sam rkang logs su bkru bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text states that the Blessed One said, “Those who do not have sandals should wash the head side or the foot side.🔽”

original: rigs pa yang de ltar kho na ste /
analyzed: rigs pa yang de ltar kho na ste /
translated: The reasoning is just that.🔽This is explained by the phrase “because of the contradiction.

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa zhes bya ba 'dis sbang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa zhes bya ba 'dis sbang ba'o //
translated: This is the so-called “disagreement.”

original: sbrul la sogs pa gnas pa'i don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa gnas pa'i don du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the purpose of a dwelling place for snakes, etc.

original: 'dir 'jug pa @277a * //
analyzed: 'dir 'jug pa @277a * //
translated: Here, the mere entry

original: tsam ni gleng gzhi las gtso bo ste /
analyzed: tsam ni gleng gzhi las gtso bo ste /
translated: is the main point of the nidana,

original: nyes dmigs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes dmigs ni ma yin no //
translated: not the disadvantage.

original: 'di ni mi bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'jug pa brten pa ma gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mi bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'jug pa brten pa ma gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One did not teach a basis for engaging in this.

original: nyes dmigs byed pa nyid kyis ltung ba dang / khrus la sogs pa la yang dag par bya ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes dmigs byed pa nyid kyis ltung ba dang / khrus la sogs pa la yang dag par bya ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that one would be engaged in bathing and so on, which are disadvantageous.

original: mgo logs sam rkang logs su 'di la shin tu yang mi mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mgo logs sam rkang logs su 'di la shin tu yang mi mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not at all disagreeable to lie on one's back or side.

original: mal stan mthon po dang / mal stan chen po la 'dug pa 'am nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
